1.text: After these things Jesus walked in Galilee: for he would not walk in Jewry, because the Jews sought to kill him.

2.text: Now the Jewâ€™s feast of tabernacles was at hand.

3.text: His brothers therefore said to him, Depart hence, and go into Judaea, that your disciples also may see the works that you do.

4.text: For there is no man that does any thing in secret, and he himself seeks to be known openly. If you do these things, show yourself to the world.

5.text: For neither did his brothers believe in him.

6.text: Then Jesus said to them, My time is not yet come: but your time is always ready.

7.text: The world cannot hate you; but me it hates, because I testify of it, that the works thereof are evil.

8.text: Go you up to this feast: I go not up yet to this feast: for my time is not yet full come.

9.text: When he had said these words to them, he stayed still in Galilee.

10.text: But when his brothers were gone up, then went he also up to the feast, not openly, but as it were in secret.

11.text: Then the Jews sought him at the feast, and said, Where is he?

12.text: And there was much murmuring among the people concerning him: for some said, He is a good man: others said, No; but he deceives the people.

13.text: However, no man spoke openly of him for fear of the Jews.

14.text: Now about the middle of the feast Jesus went up into the temple, and taught.

15.text: And the Jews marveled, saying, How knows this man letters, having never learned?

16.text: Jesus answered them, and said, My doctrine is not mine, but his that sent me.

17.text: If any man will do his will, he shall know of the doctrine, whether it be of God, or whether I speak of myself.

18.text: He that speaks of himself seeks his own glory: but he that seeks his glory that sent him, the same is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.

19.text: Did not Moses give you the law, and yet none of you keeps the law? Why go you about to kill me?

20.text: The people answered and said, You have a devil: who goes about to kill you?

21.text: Jesus answered and said to them, I have done one work, and you all marvel.

22.text: Moses therefore gave to you circumcision; (not because it is of Moses, but of the fathers;) and you on the sabbath day circumcise a man.

23.text: If a man on the sabbath day receive circumcision, that the law of Moses should not be broken; are you angry at me, because I have made a man every whit whole on the sabbath day?

24.text: Judge not according to the appearance, but judge righteous judgment.

25.text: Then said some of them of Jerusalem, Is not this he, whom they seek to kill?

26.text: But, see, he speaks boldly, and they say nothing to him. Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ?

27.text: However, we know this man from where he is: but when Christ comes, no man knows from where he is.

28.text: Then cried Jesus in the temple as he taught, saying, You both know me, and you know from where I am: and I am not come of myself, but he that sent me is true, whom you know not.

29.text: But I know him: for I am from him, and he has sent me.

30.text: Then they sought to take him: but no man laid hands on him, because his hour was not yet come.

31.text: And many of the people believed on him, and said, When Christ comes, will he do more miracles than these which this man has done?

32.text: The Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning him; and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take him.

33.text: Then said Jesus to them, Yet a little while am I with you, and then I go to him that sent me.

34.text: You shall seek me, and shall not find me: and where I am, thither you cannot come.

35.text: Then said the Jews among themselves, Where will he go, that we shall not find him? will he go to the dispersed among the Gentiles, and teach the Gentiles?

36.text: What manner of saying is this that he said, You shall seek me, and shall not find me: and where I am, thither you cannot come?

37.text: In the last day, that great day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried, saying, If any man thirst, let him come to me, and drink.

38.text: He that believes on me, as the scripture has said, out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water.

39.text: (But this spoke he of the Spirit, which they that believe on him should receive: for the Holy Ghost was not yet given; because that Jesus was not yet glorified.)

40.text: Many of the people therefore, when they heard this saying, said, Of a truth this is the Prophet.

41.text: Others said, This is the Christ. But some said, Shall Christ come out of Galilee?

42.text: Has not the scripture said, That Christ comes of the seed of David, and out of the town of Bethlehem, where David was?

43.text: So there was a division among the people because of him.

44.text: And some of them would have taken him; but no man laid hands on him.

45.text: Then came the officers to the chief priests and Pharisees; and they said to them, Why have you not brought him?

46.text: The officers answered, Never man spoke like this man.

47.text: Then answered them the Pharisees, Are you also deceived?

48.text: Have any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed on him?

49.text: But this people who knows not the law are cursed.

50.text: Nicodemus said to them, (he that came to Jesus by night, being one of them,)

51.text: Does our law judge any man, before it hear him, and know what he does?

52.text: They answered and said to him, Are you also of Galilee? Search, and look: for out of Galilee rises no prophet.

53.text: And every man went to his own house.
